Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Secretary of State for External Affairs, pursuant to section 6 of the Export and Import Permits Act, is pleased hereby to revoke the Export Control List, C.R.C., c. 601, and, pursuant to section 3* of that Act, to establish the annexed Export Control List in substitution therefor.

Section.Text: The following definitions apply in this List.

Definition.Text: Guide means A Guide to Canada’s Export Control List, published by the Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development, as amended from time to time. (Guide)

Wassenaar Arrangement means the List of Dual-Use Goods and Technologies and Munitions List that was adopted at the Plenary Meeting of the Wassenaar Arrangement on Export Controls for Conventional Arms and Dual-Use Goods and Technologies in Vienna, Austria, held on July 11 and 12, 1996, as amended from time to time. (Accord de Wassenaar)

Section.Text: The following goods and technology, when intended for export to the destinations specified, are subject to export control for the purposes set out in section 3 of the Export and Import Permits Act:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Groups 1, 2, 6, and 7 of the schedule, except for goods and technology set out in items 2-1, 2-2.a. and 2-2.b., 2-3, 2-4.a., 6-1, 6-2, 7-2, 7-3, 7-12 and 7-13 of the Guide, that are intended for export to any destination other than the United States;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Groups 3, 4 and 9 of the schedule and goods and technology set out in items 2-1, 2-2.a., 2-2.b., 2-3, 2-4.a., 6-1, 6-2, 7-3 and 7-13 of the Guide that are intended for export to any destination;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology referred to in Group 5 of the schedule that are intended for export to any destination referred to in the item of the schedule in which the goods or technology is described; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: goods and technology set out in items 7-2 and 7-12 of the Guide that are intended for export to any destination referred to in the item of the Guide in which the goods or technology is described.

Provision.Text: Goods and technology, as described in Group 1 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with the Wassenaar Arrangement.
The following goods and technology:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: goods and technology, as described in Group 2 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with the Wassenaar Arrangement, other than antique firearms as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: firearms, as defined in section 2 of the Criminal Code, other than antique firearms as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code, that are:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: set out in item 1 of Part 1 of the Schedule to the Regulations Prescribing Certain Firearms and other Weapons, Components and Parts of Weapons, Accessories, Cartridge Magazines, Ammunition and Projectiles as Prohibited or Restricted, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: designed to discharge a projectile at a muzzle velocity exceeding 152.4 m/s or at a muzzle energy exceeding 5.7 joules; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: smooth-bore weapons, firearms, automatic weapons, weapons or armaments and projectors, as described in items 2-1 and 2-2.a of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with the Inter-American Convention Against the Illicit Manufacturing of and Trafficking in Firearms, Ammunition, Explosives and other Related Materials, that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are used for hunting or sporting purposes,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: are manufactured earlier than 1938 and are not antique firearms as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: use non-centre fire cased ammunition.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 3 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: under the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons that was signed by Canada at London and Washington on July 23, 1968 and at Moscow on July 29, 1968 and that came into force for Canada on March 5, 1970; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in accordance with the procedures referred to in the Guidelines for Nuclear Transfers (INFCIRC/254/Rev.14/Part 1), issued by the Nuclear Suppliers Group, as amended from time to time.
Subsection (1) does not include goods and technology described in Group 3 of the Guide that contain

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: four grams or less of natural uranium or depleted uranium when contained in a sensing component in instruments;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: alloys containing less than 5% thorium;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: ceramic products containing thorium, which have been manufactured for non-nuclear use;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: medicinal substances containing source material;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: trace amounts of source material or special fissionable material found on contaminated items such as clothing, shielding or packaging;

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: source material which the Minister has determined will be used only in civil non-nuclear applications, such as shielding, packaging, ballasts, counter-weights or the production of alloys and ceramics;

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: four effective grams or less of special fissionable material when contained in a sensing component in instruments; or

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: plutonium 238 that is contained in heart pacemakers.
For the purpose of paragraph (2)(g), weight in effective grams is equal to

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in the case of plutonium isotopes and uranium-233, the isotope weight in grams;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of uranium enriched to 1% or greater in the isotope uranium-235, the element weight in grams multiplied by the square of its enrichment expressed as a decimal weight fraction; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: in the case of uranium enriched to below 1% in the isotope uranium-235, the element weight in grams multiplied by 0.0001.
For the purposes of paragraphs (2)(d) to (g), source material and special fissionable material have the same meanings as in the Guidelines for Nuclear Transfers referred to in paragraph (1)(b).

Deuterium, heavy water (deuterium oxide) and any other deuterium compound in which the ratio of deuterium to hydrogen atoms exceeds 1:5,000 if the Minister has determined that it is destined for use in a nuclear reactor that is capable of operating so as to maintain a controlled self-sustaining fission chain reaction.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 4 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: under the Treaty on the Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons that was signed by Canada at London and Washington on July 23, 1968 and at Moscow on July 29, 1968 and that came into force for Canada on March 5, 1970; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in accordance with the procedures referred to in the Guidelines for Transfers of Nuclear-Related Dual-Use Equipment, Materials, Software, and Related Technology (INFCIRC/254/Rev.11/Part 2), issued by the Nuclear Suppliers Group, as amended from time to time.
Logs of all species of wood. (All destinations)
Pulpwood of all species of wood. (All destinations)
Blocks, bolts, blanks, boards and any other material or product of red cedar that is suitable for use in the manufacture of shakes or shingles. (All destinations)

Softwood lumber products, as described in Annex 1A to the Softwood Lumber Agreement Between the Government of Canada and the Government of the United States of America, signed on September 12, 2006, as it read on October 12, 2015, excluding those that are described in paragraphs 3 to 5 of that Annex 1A. (United States)
Paragraph 5 of that Annex 1A is to be read without reference to the requirement set out in item (e) of that paragraph.

The references to the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (HTSUS) tariff classifications in that Annex 1A are to be read as references to the corresponding Canadian tariff classifications set out in Annex 1B to the agreement referred to in subsection (1).

The references to “imported”, “importer” and “importation” in that Annex 1A are to be read as “exported”, “exporter” and “exportation”, respectively, and the reference to “importés” in the French version of that Annex 1B is to be read as “exportés”.

Skim milk powders that are classified under subheading 0402.10, milk protein concentrates that are classified under subheading 0404.90 and infant formulas containing more than 10% on a dry weight basis of cow’s milk solids that are classified under subheading 1901.10 of the Harmonized Commodity Description and Coding System 2017. (All destinations)
Peanut butter that is classified under tariff item No. 2008.11.10 in the List of Tariff Provisions set out in the schedule to the Customs Tariff. (United States)
Sugar-containing products as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: products classified under subheadings 1701.91.54, 1704.90.74, 1806.20.75, 1806.20.95, 1806.90.55, 1901.10.74, 1901.90.69, 2101.12.54, 2101.20.54, 2106.90.78 and 2106.90.95 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the share of the in-quota quantity of the sugar-containing products tariff rate quota allocated to Canada by the United States in accordance with subparagraph 2(b) of Article 3.A.5 of Annex 3-A of Chapter 3 of CUSMA; and
Sugars, syrups and molasses as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: sugars, syrups and molasses classified under subheadings 1701.12.10, 1701.91.10, 1701.99.10, 1702.90.10 and 2106.90.44 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the share of the in-quota quantity of the refined sugar tariff rate quota allocated to Canada by the United States in accordance with subparagraph 2(a) of Article 3.A.5 of Annex 3-A of Chapter 3 of CUSMA; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: sugars, syrups and molasses classified under subheadings 1701.12.50, 1701.13.50, 1701.14.50, 1701.91.30, 1701.99.50 and 1702.90.20 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States (2020), as amended from time to time (United States), for export to the United States within the Canada-specific tariff rate quota set out in paragraph 14 of Appendix 2: Tariff Schedule of the United States – (Tariff Rate Quotas) to Annex 2-B of Chapter 2 of CUSMA.

High-sugar-containing products classified under subheadings ex 1302.20, ex 1806.10, ex 1806.20, ex 2101.12, ex 2101.20 and ex 2106.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A), containing 65 percent or more by net weight of added cane or beet sugar classified under subheadings 1701.91 to 1701.99 of Annex 5-A, for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.1 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: contain cane or beet sugar that has been refined exclusively in Canada;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Sugar confectionery and chocolate preparations classified under headings and subheadings 17.04, 1806.31, 1806.32 and 1806.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.2 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Processed foods classified under headings and subheadings 19.01, ex 1902.11, ex 1902.19, ex 1902.20, ex 1902.30, 1904.10, 1904.20, 1904.90, 19.05, 2009.81, ex 2009.89, 2103.90, ex 2106.10 and ex 2106.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.3 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Dog and cat food classified under subheadings 2309.10 and ex 2309.90 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originates in Canada and complies with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table A.4 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: is not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: is eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Apparel goods classified under headings and subheadings 6102.30, 61.04, 6108.92, 61.14, 62.01 and 62.05 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA (Annex 5-A) for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table C.2 of Annex 5-A;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA.

Vehicles classified under subheadings 8703.21, 8703.22, 8703.23, 8703.24, 8703.31, 8703.32, 8703.33, 8703.40, 8703.50, 8703.60, 8703.70, 8703.80 and 8703.90 of Council Regulation (EEC) No 2658/87 of 23 July 1987 on the tariff and statistical nomenclature and on the Common Customs Tariff, made by the European Union, for export to an EU country or other CETA beneficiary, or of the Tariff of the United Kingdom, established by regulations made under section 8 of the Taxation (Cross-Border Trade) Act 2018, c. 22, of the United Kingdom, for export to a CUKTCA beneficiary, that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: originate in Canada and comply with the product description and sufficient production criteria referred to in Table D.1 of Annex 5-A to Annex 5 of the Protocol on Rules of Origin and Origin Procedures of CETA or incorporated by reference in CUKTCA;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: are not included in another item in this List; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: are eligible for tariff elimination in accordance with the schedules in Annex 2-A of CETA or Annex 2-A to Annex B of CUKTCA.

Heading.TitleText: United States Origin Goods and Technology

Provision.Text: All goods and technology of United States origin, unless they are included elsewhere in this List, whether in bond or cleared by the Canada Border Services Agency, other than goods or technology that have been further processed or manufactured outside the United States so as to result in a substantial change in value, form or use of the goods or technology or in the production of new goods or technology. (All destinations other than the United States)

All goods and technology that originate outside Canada that are included in this List, whether in bond or cleared by the Canada Border Services Agency, other than goods or technology that are in transit on a through journey on a billing that originates outside Canada if the billing

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: indicates that the ultimate destination of the goods or technology is a country other than Canada; (All destinations other than the United States) and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the case of goods or technology that are shipped from the United States, is accompanied by a certified true copy of the United States Shipper’s Export Declaration, and that Declaration does not contain terms that conflict with those of the billing and is presented to the Canada Border Services Agency. (All destinations other than the United States)

Laser weapons that are specifically designed, as their sole combat function or as one of their combat functions, to cause permanent blindness to the naked eye or the eye with corrective eyesight devices. (All destinations)

Subject to subitem (2), systems, equipment, material, components, software and technology for use in research, development, design, testing, demonstration or training related to nuclear fusion or the construction and operation of a nuclear fusion reactor, including

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: reactor assemblies incorporating toroidal and poloidal field coils; (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: independent electrical and magnet power supply systems; (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: high-power microwave radio frequency systems; (All destinations) and

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: feedback, control and data acquisition systems. (All destinations)
This item does not apply to data

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: that is contained in published books or periodicals or that is otherwise available to the public; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: that has been made available without restrictions on its further dissemination.
Anti-personnel mines as defined in section 2 of the Anti-Personnel Mines Convention Implementation Act. (All destinations)
In this item, development, production, software, spacecraft, technology and use have the same meaning as in the provision of the Guide entitled “Definitions of Terms Used in Groups 1 and 2”.
Strategic goods and technology as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: goods and technology referred to in Group 1 of the Guide as follows,

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: global navigation satellite systems receiving equipment referred to in item 1-7.A.5. of the Guide, the associated software referred to in item 1-7.D. of the Guide, and the associated technology referred to in item 1-7.E. of the Guide (All destinations other than the United States), and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: propulsion and space-related equipment referred to in items 1-9.A.4. to 1-9.A.11. of the Guide, the associated software referred to in item 1-9.D. of the Guide, and the associated technology referred to in item 1-9.E. of the Guide; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: software that is specially designed or modified for the development or use of the goods or technology referred to in paragraphs (d) to (i); (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: technology that is specially designed or modified for the development or production of the goods or technology referred to in paragraphs (d) to (i); (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: payloads specially designed or modified for spacecraft, and specially designed components therefor, other than payloads or components that are referred to in Group 1 of the Guide; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: ground control stations for telemetry and tracking and control of space launch vehicles or spacecraft, and specially designed components therefor; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: chemiluminescent compounds specially designed or modified for military use, and specially designed components therefor; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (g)
Provision.Text: radiation-hardened microelectronic circuits that meet or exceed all of the following, and specially designed components therefor, namely:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a total dose of 5 × 105 Rads (SI),

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a dose rate upset of 5 × 108 Rads (SI)/sec,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: a neutron dose of 1 × 1014 N/cm2,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: a single event upset of 1 × 10-7 or less error/bit/day, and

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: single event latch-up free and having a dose rate latch-up of 5 × 108 Rads (SI)/sec or greater; (All destinations other than the United States)

Provision.Label: (h)
Provision.Text: nuclear weapons design and test equipment, namely:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: any article, material, equipment or device which is specially designed or modified for use in the design, development or fabrication of nuclear weapons or nuclear explosive devices, (All destinations)

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: any article, material, equipment or device which is specially designed or modified for use in the devising, carrying out or evaluating of nuclear weapons tests or other nuclear explosions; (All destinations) and

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: any other articles not specifically set out in paragraphs (a) to (h) or in Group 2 or Group 6 that are United States origin goods or technology, which have been determined under Parts 120 to 130 of Title 22 of the International Traffic in Arms Regulations of the Code of Federal Regulations (United States) as having substantial military applicability, and which have been specially designed or modified for military purposes. (All destinations other than in the United States)

Heading.TitleText: Goods and Technology for Certain Uses

Provision.Text: Goods and technology whether or not included elsewhere on the List if their properties and any information made known to the exporter by any intermediary or final consignee or from any other source would lead a reasonable person to suspect that they will be used

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in the development, production, handling, operation, maintenance, storage, detection, identification or dissemination of

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: chemical or biological weapons,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: nuclear explosive or radiological dispersal devices, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: materials or equipment that could be used in such weapons or devices;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: in the development, production, handling, operation, maintenance or storage of

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: missiles or other systems capable of delivering chemical or biological weapons or nuclear explosive or radiological dispersal devices, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: materials or equipment that could be used in such missiles or systems; or

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: in any facility used for any of the activities described in paragraphs (a) and (b).

Goods and technology whether or not included elsewhere on the List if the Minister has determined, on the basis of their properties and any additional information relating to such matters as their intended end-use or the identity or conduct of their intermediary or final consignees, that they are likely to be used in the activities or facilities referred to in subitem (1).
Subitem (1) applies to goods and technology intended for export to all destinations unless

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: they are intended for end-use in Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, New Zealand, Norway, Poland, Portugal, the Republic of Korea, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey, Ukraine, the United Kingdom or the United States;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: their intermediary consignees, if any, are located in those countries; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: their final consignee is located in one of those countries.
Subitem (2) applies to goods and technology intended for export to all destinations.

Heading.TitleText: Other Strategic Goods and Technology (All Destinations Other than the United States)

Provision.Text: In this item, composite, development, electronic assembly, Gate-All-Around Field-Effect Transistor (GAAFET), laser, matrix, production, software, substrate, substrate blanks, technology and use have the same meaning as in the Guide under the heading “Definitions of Terms Used in Groups 1 and 2”.
Other strategic goods and technology as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: subject to the “General Software Note” in Group 1 of the Guide, software, other than that referred to in Group 1 of the Guide, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: software specially designed or modified for the development or production of items specified in clause (c)(ii)(B) or (C), or any of subparagraphs (c)(iii) and (d)(iii), (iv) and (vi) to (viii),

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: software specially designed for the use of items specified in subparagraph (d)(iii),

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: software designed to extract Graphic Design System II (GDSII) or equivalent standard layout data and perform layer-to-layer alignment from Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) images, and to generate multi-layer GDSII data or the circuit netlist, and
NOTE
In subparagraph (iii), Graphic Design System II (GDSII) means a database file format for the data exchange of integrated circuit artwork or integrated circuit layout artwork.

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: software specially designed or modified for the development or production of items specified in subparagraph (d)(v);

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: subject to the “General Technology Note” in Group 1 of the Guide, technology, other than that are referred to in Group 1 of the Guide, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: technology specially designed or modified for the development or production of items specified in clause (c)(ii)(B) or (C), subparagraph (c)(iii) or (iv), any of subparagraphs (d)(iii) to (viii) or paragraph (e),

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: technology specially designed or modified for the development or production of integrated circuits or of devices, using Gate-All-Around Field-Effect Transistor (GAAFET) structures,
NOTE
Subparagraph (ii) includes process recipes. Process recipe means a set of conditions and parameters for a particular process step.
Subparagraph (ii) does not apply to technology used for tool qualification or maintenance.

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: technology for the development or production of coating systems that are designed to protect ceramic matrix composite materials specified in item 1-1.C.7 of the Guide from corrosion, and to operate at temperatures exceeding 1,373.15 K (1,100℃), and
NOTE
In subparagraph (iii), coating system means a coating consisting of materials in one or more layers – for example, bond, interlayer, top coat – deposited on a substrate.

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: technology for the development of software specified in subparagraph (a)(iv);

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: systems, equipment and components, other than those referred to in Group 1 of the Guide, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor (CMOS) integrated circuits designed to operate at an ambient temperature equal to or less (better) than 4.5 K (-268.65°C),
NOTE
For the purposes of subparagraph (i), Complementary Metal Oxide Semiconductor (CMOS) integrated circuits can also be referred to as cryogenic CMOS or cryoCMOS.

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: quantum computers and related electronic assemblies and components therefor, as follows:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: quantum computers, as follows:

Provision.Label: (I)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 34 or more, but fewer than 100, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 10-4,

Provision.Label: (II)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 100 or more, but fewer than 200, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 10-3,

Provision.Label: (III)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 200 or more, but fewer than 350, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 2 x 10-3,

Provision.Label: (IV)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 350 or more, but fewer than 500, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 3 x 10-3,

Provision.Label: (V)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 500 or more, but fewer than 700, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 4 x 10-3,

Provision.Label: (VI)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 700 or more, but fewer than 1,100, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 5 x 10-3,

Provision.Label: (VII)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 1,100 or more, but fewer than 2,000, fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits, and having a C-NOT error of less than or equal to 6 x 10-3, and

Provision.Label: (VIII)
Provision.Text: quantum computers supporting 2,000 or more fully controlled, connected and working physical qubits,

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: qubit devices and qubit circuits, containing or supporting arrays of physical qubits, and specially designed for items specified in clause (A), and

Provision.Label: (C)
Provision.Text: quantum control components and quantum measurement devices specially designed for items specified in clause (A),
NOTE

Items in clause (B) include semiconductor, superconducting and photonic qubit chips and chip arrays, surface ion trap arrays, other qubit confinement technology, and coherent interconnects between such items.
Clause (C) applies to items designed for calibrating, initializing, manipulating or measuring the resident qubits of a quantum computer.
Subparagraph (ii) applies to circuit model (or gate-based) and one-way (or measurement-based) quantum computers but does not apply to adiabatic (or annealing) quantum computers.

Items specified in subparagraph (ii) may not necessarily physically contain any qubits. For example, quantum computers based on photonic schemes do not permanently contain a physical item that can be identified as a qubit. Instead, photonic qubits are generated while the computer is operating and then later discarded.

In subparagraph (ii), physical qubit means a two-level quantum system used to represent the elementary unit of quantum logic by means of manipulations and measurements that are not error-corrected. Physical qubits are distinguished from logical qubits, in that logical qubits are error-corrected qubits composed of many physical qubits.

In clause (A), supporting 34 or more fully controlled, connected, working physical qubits refers to the capability of a quantum computer to confine, control, measure and process the quantum information embodied in 34 or more physical qubits.
In clause (A), fully controlled means that the physical qubit can be calibrated, initialized, gated and read out, as necessary.

In clause (A), connected means that two-qubit gate operations can be performed between any arbitrary pair of the available working physical qubits. This does not necessarily entail all-to-all connectivity.
In clause (A), working means that the physical qubit performs universal quantum computational work according to the system specifications for qubit operational fidelity.
In clause (A), C-NOT error means the average physical gate error for the nearest-neighbour two-physical qubit Controlled-NOT (C-NOT) gates.

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: parametric signal amplifiers designed to operate at an ambient temperature below 1 K (-272.15 ℃) and at a frequency from 2 GHz to 15 GHz, and having a noise figure of less than 0.015 dB when operating at that temperature and frequency,
NOTE
In subparagraph (iii), parametric signal amplifier, or Quantum-Limited Amplifier (QLA), includes a Travelling Wave Parametric Amplifier (TWPA).

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: cryogenic cooling systems and components, as follows:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: systems rated to provide a cooling power of 600 µW or more at a temperature of 0.1 K (-273.05°C) or lower for more than 48 hours, and

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: two-stage pulse tube cryocoolers rated to maintain a temperature lower than 4 K (-269.15°C) and to provide a cooling power of 1.5 W or more at a temperature of 4.2 K (-268.95°C) or lower;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: test, inspection and production equipment, other than that referred to in Group 1 of the Guide, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: masks and reticles designed for integrated circuits specified in subparagraph (c)(i),

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: imprint lithography templates designed for integrated circuits specified in subparagraph (c)(i),

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: equipment designed for dry etching, as follows:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: equipment designed or modified for isotropic dry etching and having a largest silicon-germanium to silicon (SiGe:Si) etch selectivity greater than or equal to 100:1, or
NOTE
For the purposes of clause (A), silicon-germanium to silicon (SiGe:Si) etch selectivity is measured for a germanium (Ge) concentration of greater than or equal to 30% (Si0.70Ge0.30).

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: equipment designed or modified for anisotropic dry etching, and having all of the following:

Provision.Label: (I)
Provision.Text: one or more Radio Frequency (RF) power sources with at least one pulsed Radio Frequency (RF) output,

Provision.Label: (II)
Provision.Text: one or more fast gas switching valves with a switching time of less than 300 ms,

Provision.Label: (III)
Provision.Text: an electrostatic chuck with 20 or more individually controllable variable temperature elements, and
NOTE

Clause (B) includes etching using Radio Frequency (RF) pulse excited plasma, pulsed duty cycle excited plasma, pulsed voltage on electrodes modified plasma, or cyclic injection and purging of gases combined with a plasma; plasma atomic layer etching; and plasma quasi-atomic layer etching.
Subparagraph (iii) includes etching by radicals, ions, sequential reactions, or non-sequential reaction.
In note 2, radical means an atom, molecule, or ion that has an unpaired electron in an open electron shell configuration.

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) equipment designed for imaging semiconductor devices or integrated circuits, and having all of the following:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: a stage placement accuracy less (better) than 30 nm,

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: a stage positioning measurement performed using laser interferometry,

Provision.Label: (C)
Provision.Text: a position calibration within a Field-of-View (FOV) based on laser interferometer length-scale measurement,

Provision.Label: (D)
Provision.Text: a collection and storage of images with more than 2 x 108 pixels,

Provision.Label: (E)
Provision.Text: a Field-of-View (FOV) overlap of less than 5% in vertical and horizontal directions,

Provision.Label: (F)
Provision.Text: a Field-of-View (FOV) stitching overlap of less than 50 nm, and

Provision.Label: (G)
Provision.Text: an accelerating voltage of more than 21 kV,
NOTE
Subparagraph (iv) includes Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) equipment designed for chip design recovery.

Subparagraph (iv) does not apply to Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) equipment designed to accept a Semiconductor Equipment and Materials International (SEMI) standard wafer carrier, such as a 200 mm or larger Front Opening Unified Pod (FOUP).

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: additive manufacturing machines designed to produce metal or metal alloy components and having the following characteristics, and specially designed components for those machines:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: the consolidation source is one or more of the following :

Provision.Label: (I)
Provision.Text: a laser,

Provision.Label: (II)
Provision.Text: an electron beam, or

Provision.Label: (III)
Provision.Text: an electric arc,

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: during manufacturing, the controlled process atmosphere consists of:

Provision.Label: (I)
Provision.Text: an inert gas, or

Provision.Label: (II)
Provision.Text: a vacuum (pressure equal to or less than 100 Pa),

Provision.Label: (C)
Provision.Text: the in-process monitoring equipment in a coaxial or paraxial configuration has any of the following:

Provision.Label: (I)
Provision.Text: an imaging camera with a peak response at a wavelength that is greater than 380 nm and less than or equal to 14,000 nm,

Provision.Label: (II)
Provision.Text: a pyrometer designed to measure temperatures greater than 1,273.15K (1,000°C), or

Provision.Label: (III)
Provision.Text: a radiometer or spectrometer with a peak response at a wavelength that is greater than 380 nm and less than or equal to 3,000 nm, and

Provision.Label: (D)
Provision.Text: the closed-loop control systems are designed to modify the consolidation source parameters, build paths, or equipment settings during the build cycle in response to feedback from in-process monitoring equipment specified in clause (C),
NOTE

In clauses (C) and (D), in-process monitoring, also known as in-situ process monitoring, means the observation and measurement of the additive manufacturing process including the measurement of electromagnetic or thermal emissions from the melt pool.

In clause (C), coaxial configuration, also known as on-axis or inline configuration, means a configuration in which one or more sensors are mounted in an optical path shared by the laser consolidation source.
In clause (C), paraxial configuration means a configuration in which one or more sensors are mounted onto or integrated into the laser, electron beam, or electric arc consolidation source component.

In clause (C), for both coaxial configuration and paraxial configuration, the field of view of the sensors is fixed to the moving reference frame of the consolidation source and moves in the same scan trajectory throughout the build process.

Provision.Label: (vi)
Provision.Text: Extreme Ultraviolet (EUV) lithography masks and EUV lithography reticles, designed for integrated circuits, and having mask substrate blanks specified in paragraph 1-3.B.1.j of the Guide,
NOTE
Subparagraph (vi) also applies to masks and reticles with a mounted pellicle.

Provision.Label: (vii)
Provision.Text: pellicles specially designed for EUV lithography, and
NOTE
In subparagraphs (vi) and (vii), pellicle means a membrane that is integrated with a frame and that is designed to protect a mask or reticle from particle contamination.
In subparagraphs (vi) and (vii), Extreme Ultraviolet means electromagnetic spectrum wavelengths greater than 5 nm and less than 124 nm.

Provision.Label: (viii)
Provision.Text: cryogenic wafer probing equipment designed to test devices at a temperature less than or equal to 4.5 K (-268.65°C), and to accommodate wafer diameters greater than or equal to 100 mm;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: materials, other than those referred to in Group 1 of the Guide, as follows:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: epitaxial materials consisting of a substrate having at least one epitaxially grown layer of any of the following:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: silicon having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of silicon isotopes other than silicon-28 or silicon-30, or

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: germanium having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of germanium isotopes other than germanium-70, germanium-72, germanium-74, or germanium-76,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: fluorides, hydrides, or chlorides, of silicon or germanium, containing any of the following:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: silicon having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of silicon isotopes other than silicon-28 or silicon-30, or

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: germanium having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of germanium isotopes other than germanium-70, germanium-72, germanium-74, or germanium-76, and

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: silicon, silicon oxides, germanium or germanium oxides, containing any of the following:

Provision.Label: (A)
Provision.Text: silicon having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of silicon isotopes other than silicon-28 or silicon-30, or

Provision.Label: (B)
Provision.Text: germanium having an isotopic impurity of less than 0.08% of germanium isotopes other than germanium-70, germanium-72, germanium-74, or germanium-76.
NOTE
Subparagraph (iii) includes substrates, lumps, ingots, boules and preforms of those materials.

Goods and technology, as described in Group 6 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control under bilateral arrangements concluded on April 7, 1987, in accordance with the Guidelines for Sensitive Missile-Relevant Transfers, issued by the Missile Technology Control Regime to control the export of missile equipment and technology referred to in the MTCR/TEM/2019/Annex of October 11, 2019, as amended from time to time.
Goods and technology, as described in Group 7 of the Guide, the export of which Canada has agreed to control

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: in accordance with the Guidelines for Transfers of Sensitive Chemical or Biological Items and the Common Control Lists, as amended from time to time, that are issued by the Australia Group to control the export of chemical and biological weapons; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: under the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on Their Destruction, signed at Paris, France, on January 13, 1993, as amended from time to time.

The goods referred to in items 9-1 to 9-9, whether or not included elsewhere in this List, the export of which Canada has agreed to control in accordance with its obligations under the Arms Trade Treaty.
Battle tanks that are tracked or wheeled self-propelled armoured fighting vehicles weighing at least 16.5 t unladen, with a direct fire main gun of at least 75 mm calibre.
Armoured combat vehicles as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: tracked, semi-tracked or wheeled self-propelled vehicles with armoured protection and cross-country capability having any of the following characteristics:

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: designed or modified and equipped to transport a squad of four or more infantry soldiers,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: armed with an integral or organic weapon of at least 12.5 mm calibre,

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: equipped with a missile launcher,

Provision.Label: (iv)
Provision.Text: equipped with organic technical means for observation, reconnaissance and target indication and designed to perform reconnaissance missions,

Provision.Label: (v)
Provision.Text: equipped with integral or organic technical means for command of troops,

Provision.Label: (vi)
Provision.Text: equipped with integral or organic electronic and technical means designed for electronic warfare; and

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: armoured bridge-launching vehicles.
Large-calibre artillery systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: guns, howitzers, mortars – and artillery pieces that combine the characteristics of a gun or howitzer – that are capable of engaging surface targets by delivering indirect fire and have

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: a calibre of at least 75 mm but not greater than 155 mm, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: a calibre greater than 155 mm;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: multiple-launch rocket systems that are capable of engaging surface targets by delivering indirect fire and have a calibre of at least 75 mm; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: gun carriers specially designed for towing artillery.
Military aircraft and related systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: manned fixed-wing or variable-geometry wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided missiles, unguided rockets, bombs, guns, cannons or other weapons of destruction, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, command-of-troops, electronic warfare, suppression of air-defence systems, refuelling or airdrop missions;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: unmanned fixed-wing or variable-geometry wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided missiles, unguided rockets, bombs, guns, cannons or other weapons of destruction, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare or suppression of air-defence systems missions; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: systems for the control and receiving of information from the unmanned aircraft referred to in paragraph (b).
Military helicopters and related systems as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: manned rotary-wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided or unguided anti-armour, air-to-surface, air-to-subsurface or air-to-air weapons for which the aircraft are equipped with an integrated fire control and aiming system, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare, target acquisition (including anti-submarine warfare), communications, command-of-troops or minelaying missions;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: unmanned rotary-wing aircraft that are designed, equipped or modified to

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: engage targets by employing guided or unguided anti-armour, air-to-surface, air-to-subsurface or air-to-air weapons for which the aircraft are equipped with an integrated fire control and aiming system, or

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: perform reconnaissance, electronic warfare or suppression of air-defence systems missions; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: systems for the control and receiving of information from the unmanned aircraft referred to in paragraph (b).
Vessels and submarines that are armed and equipped for military use and that

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: have a standard displacement equal to or greater than 150 t; or

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: have a standard displacement of less than 150 t and are equipped for launching missiles or torpedoes with a range of 25 km or greater.
Missiles and missile launchers, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: guided or unguided rockets and ballistic or cruise missiles that are capable of delivering a warhead or weapon of destruction to a range of 25 km or greater;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: launchers that are specially designed or modified for launching the missiles or rockets referred to in paragraph (a), if not included in any of items 9-1 to 9-6; and

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: man-portable air-defense systems (MANPADS).
Paragraph (1)(a) includes remotely piloted vehicles that have the characteristics of the missiles or rockets described in that subsection.
Small arms that are destined for police or military end-use by individual members, as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: handguns that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function,

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: are semi-automatic in function, or

Provision.Label: (iii)
Provision.Text: are revolvers;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: rifles other than those specified in paragraph (d);

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: submachine guns that are automatic or converted automatic in function;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: assault rifles that are automatic or converted automatic in function; and

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: light machine guns that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: have a calibre of 12.7mm or less,
Subsection (1) does not include

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed for dummy or blank ammunition and are incapable of discharging a projectile or marking cartridges;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed for marking or for force-on-force type training ammunition;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: firearms that are specially designed to launch tethered projectiles having no high-explosive charge or communications link to a range of 500 m or less; or

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: antique firearms as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code.
Light weapons destined for use by individual members of armed or security forces or by several members serving as a crew and delivering primarily direct fire as follows:

Provision.Label: (a)
Provision.Text: heavy machine guns, other than the grenade launchers specified in paragraph (b), that

Provision.Label: (i)
Provision.Text: are automatic or converted automatic in function, and

Provision.Label: (ii)
Provision.Text: have a calibre greater than 12.7 mm;

Provision.Label: (b)
Provision.Text: hand-held grenade launchers, under-barrel-mounted grenade launchers and mounted grenade launchers;

Provision.Label: (c)
Provision.Text: portable anti-tank guns;

Provision.Label: (d)
Provision.Text: recoilless rifles;

Provision.Label: (e)
Provision.Text: portable anti-tank missile launchers and rocket systems; and

Provision.Label: (f)
Provision.Text: mortars that have a calibre less than 75 mm.
Subsection (1) does not include antique firearms, as defined in subsection 84(1) of the Criminal Code.
